Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech, which is essential for democracy.
The government should not decide what opinions are permissible.
The ACMA should not be the arbiter of truth.
There has been excessive censorship over the past three years, leading to a loss of trust in institutions.
The bill excludes government and professional news content from misinformation scrutiny, which is seen as undemocratic and Orwellian.
Silencing speech historically leads to negative outcomes.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is paramount to a democracy.
The ACMA should not be the arbiter of what is the truth.
This sounds extremely Orwellian and not at all democratic.
Without Freedom of thought there can be no such thing as wisdom; and no such thing as public liberty, without freedom of speech.
